New Records: Meadows' grand slam was the second-fastest pitch a Tigers player has homered off of in the pitch-tracking era that started in 2008
Key Match Events: Parker Meadows hit a grand slam on a full count with two outs in the ninth inning to give the Detroit Tigers a 4-3 victory over the San Diego Padres
Post-Match Reflections: There is a lot of fight in this group. There is a lot of desire to be good and finish these games
It is momentum going into the next series
Never count us out. You have seen it all year and we were able to do it again tonight, so it was pretty fun
Miscellaneous Highlights: Tigers reliever Ricky Vanasco won his first game of the season with a scoreless eighth
Tyler Holton earned his seventh save with a scoreless ninth
Jurickson Profar hit his 22nd home run, a solo shot, in the first inning
Xander Bogaerts hit a two-run homer in the second inning to give San Diego a 3-0 lead

Tigers starter Casey Mize lasted 5 1/3 innings and gave up three runs on six hits

Fernando Tatis Jr., who hit an RBI single with two outs in the 10th inning to give the Padres a 6-5 victory over the Tigers on Wednesday night in his second game back from the IL, went 0 for 4 on Thursday night
